A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I thought The Last Jedi was a great movie. Rian Johnson wrote and directed arguably one of the best Star Wars movies up to this point. Every moment was powerful and emotionally moving. The plot moved through the 2.5 hour runtime flawlessly. Regardless what people may think about Johnson killing off Snoke and revealing (and/or possibly redirecting) who Rey’s parents were\, Johnson took Star Wars into a different direction\, leaving the original trilogy in past and bringing the fans of Star Wars (including myself) toward something new and fresh. People who thought TLJ wasn’t a true Star Wars movie\, they’re not letting themselves be open to something different in this fantastic universe. I’m looking forward to see what J.J Abrams does to finish off this new trilogy in Episode IX.
